title: 114_hr4886
content:
The "Closing the Pre-Paid Mobile Device Security Gap Act of 2016" requires purchasers of pre-paid mobile devices or SIM cards to provide their full name, complete home address, and date of birth before completing a sale. An authorized reseller making an in-person sale must verify purchaser information by requiring a photographic ID issued by the government or two of the following documents: Form W-2 from the IRS or Form 1099 from the Social Security Administration. An authorized reseller making a sale to a purchaser not in person must verify purchaser information by requiring specific documents, such as Form 1099 from the Social Security Administration or any other document approved by the Attorney General. To comply with section 2, the purchaser must provide credit/debit card details, Social Security number, driver's license number, and any other necessary personal information as determined by the Attorney General. SEC. 4. RECORD MAKING REQUIREMENT. Upon sale of a pre-paid mobile device or SIM card, an authorized reseller must record purchaser information, sale date, manufacturer, wireless carrier, assigned telephone number, and international mobile equipment identifier number if applicable. The curr_chunk lists different identifiers including International mobile equipment identifier number, Electronic serial number, Mobile equipment identifier, International mobile subscriber identifier, and Machine address code. SEC. 5 requires authorized resellers to transmit sales records of prepaid mobile devices or SIM cards to the wireless carrier within 30 days via secure electronic transmission. SEC. 6 outlines recordkeeping requirements. SEC. 6 outlines that after transmitting a sale record to a wireless carrier, the carrier must provide a confirmation receipt to the reseller and retain the record for 18 months or until service discontinues. (a) False or Misleading Statements.--A purchaser providing false information under sections 2 and 3 may be fined or imprisoned up to 5 years. For offenses related to terrorism or specific chapters, imprisonment may be up to 8 years. 
(b) Failure To Comply.--The Attorney General may impose a $50 civil penalty for each offense committed by an authorized reseller or wireless carrier under this Act. Failure to comply with identification and record-keeping requirements for pre-paid mobile devices or SIM cards by authorized resellers and wireless carriers will result in separate offenses. Authorized resellers must request and verify purchaser identification, make records, and transmit them. Wireless carriers must provide transmission confirmation receipts and retain sale records. Failure to comply with identification and record-keeping requirements for pre-paid mobile devices or SIM cards by authorized resellers and wireless carriers will result in separate offenses. This section clarifies that wireless carriers are not liable for offenses committed by authorized resellers, and vice versa. SEC. 8. RELATED OFFENSES. Unauthorized resellers are prohibited from selling pre-paid mobile devices or SIM cards, with a penalty of up to 2 years imprisonment or a fine. The Attorney General must establish rules for manufacturers or authorized resellers to notify purchasers of this offense. If someone uses a pre-paid mobile device obtained through false information to commit a federal crime, they face a minimum term of imprisonment required by federal law. If a minimum term of imprisonment is required by federal law for an offense, the term shall be increased by 1 year. SEC. 9. PRESERVATION OF STATE LAW. This Act does not preempt State requirements on mobile device distribution and sale or prevent States from enacting such requirements. SEC. 10. DEFINITIONS. In this Act, the term "authorized reseller" refers to a person authorized by a manufacturer or wireless carrier to sell mobile devices or SIM cards. A "pre-paid mobile device" is a cellular phone where the user purchases a set allotment of wireless communication service. A "SIM card" is a subscriber identity module or data storage device, and a "wireless carrier" is a provider of wireless communication service. The curr_chunk defines "wireless communication service" as commercial mobile service or commercial mobile data service.
